West Elm (Nashville, TN) / Via Facebook: westelmMontreal ID: 10567767 
West Elm has quietly removed a couch from its website that some consumers have complained is ‚Äúthe absolute worst piece of furniture‚Äù they have purchased. Store workers in New York, Alabama and Connecticut also said the couch is no longer available in stores. 
For years, consumers have complained that the company‚Äôs Peggy Couch, a tufted midcentury modern couch, comes with buttons that pop off, sometimes after just weeks of use. 
But the final straw appears to have been an essay published by The Awl last week, where writer Anna Hezel described her arduous struggle with the couch, which was her first piece of investment furniture. Days after the essay was published, the popular couch was no longer visible on the company‚Äôs site.
